name: The Old Vicarage Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a groupon offer for £89 instead of the usual price of £255. We had a nice stay, but I would have been disappointed if I’d paid the full price ticket.
reviews.title: Nice restaurant, just check the room spec before you arrive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we booked I noticed on their website that there were a few smaller sized rooms with double beds. Knowing we like at least a king size when we go away, I asked for one of the larger rooms when I booked. However when we checked in we were in a double-bedded room. It did have a lovely bathroom, with a beautiful freestanding bath, but there was no shower and most worrying, no bathroom door – if this is a problem for you it may be worth checking exactly which room you’re getting before you book.
reviews.title: Choose your room carefully.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of the deal we were given a glass of champagne and some chocolate dipped strawberries. The groupon deal also included breakfast in bed and a rose petal turndown – we were told that it was only continental breakfast in bed, so if we wanted a cooked breakfast we could come down to the restaurant instead. We did this and it was very nice. We didn’t get the rose petal turndown.
reviews.title: Would definitely go again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant which was excellent – great menu with plenty to choose from and the staff were all so attentive. Two main courses, two drinks, two desserts and two coffees came to just over £60 – not cheap, but you got what you paid for.
reviews.title: Fantastic wedding location with excellent food and service
Excellent Hotel and service with a smile
reviews.text: The hotel is on the edge of Southwell, just an easy 15-20 minute walk away from the town centre. There are some lovely coffee shops, delis, traditional pubs and shops if you fancy getting out and about.

We stayed for the weekend to attend a friends wedding held there. It is a lovely venue. We ended up in a downstairs room & could hear a bit of background noise but we cannot complain as the hotel bent over backwards to accommodate many last minute changes with room bookings due to the fact that the brides mother was taken very ill & unable to attend. The room was comfortable & well decorated. The bed was fabulously comfortable with crisp white sheets. Have to say I did have a problem with the open plan bathroom, had to make my husband use the loo in the corridor outside!
reviews.title: Attended a friends wedding. Lovely venue.

reviews.text: Ate in the restaurant & ordered steak. We both asked for med/rare & they came out too well done for our liking. My husband sent his back & it was dealt with efficiently.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding Reception
This is a firm favourite - already booked again
reviews.text: The bride had the entire staff at her beck & call & even had them touching up a watermark on the ceiling! They willingly bent over backwards to please her with nary a grimace! The wedding itself was fabulous, the waiting staff were really lovely, particularly the stunning twin girls & Michael. It was ideal for a wedding & the lawns are really beautiful & well kept.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only other criticism is lack of wheelchair access around the hotel. It wasn't ideal that a guest had to be carried on & off decking & up & down steps.
reviews.title: A lovely night away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that it was really superb.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in gorgeous suroundings

reviews.text: The photos on the website promised a quality hotel and I had high expectations.
reviews.title: Nice bed but scalding shower

reviews.text: Although the rooms were very nicely furnished, our stay was ruined by a faulty shower. When shown the rooms we were shown how to use the shower because the “control was sensitive”, but there only seems to be one temperature, scalding hot.
reviews.title: Fantastic a true Gem of an Hotel

reviews.text: After trying for 20 minutes to regulate the heat, I phoned Lisa the receptionist who advised me to try again. After trying for another 5 minutes I tried again but the phone wasn’t answered and it seemed like the receiver was picked up and cut off - three times!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went down to reception and we were given access to a member of staff’s room so we could shower there. Same problem – scalding shower. She said she would check our shower while we were out, but said it would be difficult to get a repair man at short notice.
reviews.title: Almost excellent....outstanding restaurant. Would go back again

reviews.text: The next morning the shower was still scalding.
reviews.title: nice hotel but seems to treat guests depending on spend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife ,five friends and myself enjoyed a super evening of attentive service from not only the owner,Suzanne , but all the front of house staff.The food cooked and served was of a superb standard - no wonder another AA rosette for the chefs in their careers. We all have no hesitation in recommending this hotel/restaurant to everybody. We will all return.
reviews.title: Super food service and ambience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Paul and Jayne Keyes ,Nottingham
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed over at the hotel night as a birthday treat for her. She and I were both absolutely amazed by the quality of service and the unique styling of the hotel and room. I don't think we could have asked for anything more, the food was delicious, staff were so attentive and the room we were given was the best room we've ever stayed in anywhere! What you see in the pictures on the website is what you get - its a real gem!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, beautiful rooms shame about the miserable receptionist

reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here for one night, we were meeting family who checked in on the friday.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.text: I chose this hotel as the pictures looked amazing and I always think if a hotel has nice toiletries it is bound to go that extra mile.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing and very comfortable.

description: The Old Vicarage, Southwell situated on Westhorpe, has undergone a major redevelopment and refurbishment programme over the last 2 years, and is delighted to be opening on the 1st May 2009 as Southwell’s finest hotel. The Old Vicarage brings Southwell its first unique hotel experience, taking comfort and personal service to new heights. We offer pure guest luxury, down to small details such as Molton Brown products and Royal Doulton cutlery.Offering uniquely styled accommodation in 8 individually designed bedrooms and suites. Featuring an eclectic mix of new york loft meets vintage chic. Set within over an acre of conservation area, it is the ideal venue for weddings and functions or simply to get away from it all!
